intro: Apollonias barbujana subsp. ceballosi, commonly known as the Ceballos' apollonias, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecological niche.
